title: Set parameter values on the correct thread
message:
Set parameter values on the correct thread

Effect parameter values need to be set on the render thread (because they delegate the value to the effect shader), and with this change, the SpectaculumView takes care of it. Before, this had to be done explicitly through spectaculumView.queueEvent.

title: Fix DASH live streaming segment number offset accumulation bug
message:
Fix DASH live streaming segment number offset accumulation bug

The calculated offset was added to the segment template's start number for every representation, which resulted in wrongly accumulated start number offsets when the segment template was passed from the adaptation set and thus shared between all the representations (when there is no overwriting adaptation set in the representation).

title: Take load from decoder by pausing the loop while no output is available
message:
Take load from decoder by pausing the loop while no output is available

Before, the decoder was looping and requesting a decoded video frame until it became available, wasting processing power while the decoder needed time to decode the frame. Now we just ask for the frame once and then delay the next query for some time, putting the decoder loop to sleep.

message:
Fix playback sometimes not starting

The paused flag must be set before sending the playback message, else it can happen that the playback call is executed before the flag is set and the loop method thinks playback is paused and pauses itself. For the user this looks as if playback does not start.

title: Fix that fucking handler delay problem
message:
Fix that fucking handler delay problem

Been searching for months for the source of the problem that delayed messages in the mediaplayer handler took 5x longer than specified, leading to bad playback performance and stuttering. Turns out it's the AsyncTask's low priority that affects all threads created from the async task, no matter which priority they are given.

title: Add support for multiplexed DASH representation streams
message:
Add support for multiplexed DASH representation streams

Previously, when converting an MP4 fragment into a normal MP4 file that the Android MediaExtractor can read, only the first track box has been copied because it was assumed that DASH representations are always single streams - which is wrong. Now all MP4 track boxes are copied over into the converted fragment.

title: Improve release
message:
Improve release

Changes the thread-internal name from destroy to release and tries to get rid of all unnecessary events in the queue that would just waste resources and slow down the release.

title: Replace playback loop thread with a new handler based playback thread
message:
Replace playback loop thread with a new handler based playback thread

This commit greatly improves the design, handling and readability of the playback thread by replacing the still messy playback loop with a message based approach. Playback performance is improved (playback more smoothly, less cpu time), and the Thread.sleep is replaced from API 21 with the new timed release and rendering method.

message: Add timed render mode for smoother rendering on API 21+

title: Fix audio playback problems
message:
Fix audio playback problems

The audio didn't play back if playback was started before the decoder loop went into the pause block. In some other cases, short bursts of unexpected audio were played back.

title: Improve API compatibility: do not render first frame automatically
message:
Improve API compatibility: do not render first frame automatically

The Android MediaPlayer and VideoView do not render anything until play or seekTo has been called. To render the first frame as before, just call seekTo(0) after calling prepare or in the onPrepared handler when calling prepareAsync.

title: Improve API compatibility: add prepare/prepareAsync
message:
Improve API compatibility: add prepare/prepareAsync

This also moves the MEDIA_PREPARED message sending to the expected place, similar to the Android MediaPlayer.

message:
Seek to first frame if seek has been issued before playback is started

This does not work yet, because the MEDIA_PREPARED message has to be sent earlier before playback starts, to give the caller the possibility to set a seek position before starting playback.

message:

title: Fix seeking from the end of the input stream
message:
Fix seeking from the end of the input stream

When seeking to the end of a stream and the end of the input stream is reached, the mVideoInputEos flag gets set to true. A following seek then resulted in an infinite loop of the media player waiting for a decoded frame, because due to the flag, no more sample data was read from the extractor and fed to the decoder, and the decoder therefore never emitted a decoded frame. Fixes GitHub issue #9.

title: Increase timeout and remove sleep during initialization
message: Increase timeout and remove sleep during initialization

title: Add audio decoding buffer timeout debug output
message: Add audio decoding buffer timeout debug output

title: Fix OnSeekListener being called from wrong thread
message:
Fix OnSeekListener being called from wrong thread

The OnSeekListener added in commit ed303b561 was called from the seekTo method, which was also called internally by the PlaybackThread of the MediaPlayer on some occasions, leading to the listener being called by an unexpected thread. This commit splits the onSeek method into a private method for internal MediaPlayer calls that does not call any listeners, and a public method that calls the listener.

title: Release old MediaPlayer instance before creating a new one
message:
Release old MediaPlayer instance before creating a new one

When setting a new video source on a video view without calling stopPlayback(), release the old MediaPlayer instance before a new one is created.

title: Add stopPlayback() methods to the video views
message:
Add stopPlayback() methods to the video views

This also changes the stop() behavior in MediaPlayer, which is now blocking until the playback thread is stopped. This can make a difference when stopping while a seek is in progress, because it now waits until the seek call returns, which can take some time with online streams on a slow connection.

title: Fix DASH seeking issues with multiple shortly following requests
message:
Fix DASH seeking issues with multiple shortly following requests

This problem appeared in the demo app because the Android MediaController issues seek requests whenever a seek happens on the timeline slider. When the user touches the slider to seek and moves the finger a tiny bit while touching, multiple (mostly two) seeks are requested... these shortly following consecutive seeks triggered the problem that this commit solves, which led to the seek operation not being carried out as the user expected it.

title: Remove async DASH-MPD processing from library
message:
Remove async DASH-MPD processing from library

This removes the async processing through AsyncTask from the DashParser. This still needs to be called off the main thread to avoid an NetworkOnMainThreadException, but now the user can decide where and how to do the async processing. The demo app now uses an AsyncTask.

title: Disable spammy debug output
message: Disable spammy debug output

title: Improve DASH representation switching and fix seeking
message:
Improve DASH representation switching and fix seeking

The reinitialization of the codec for the new format is now getting deferred until all frames of the old representation have been rendered. Before, these frames were lost and skipped, resulting in a jittery representation switch. This also fixes seeking into representations that differ from the active representation. There is still a bit of a lag when switching representations, resulting from the MediaCodec initialization which takes some time. The video resolution changed message is also getting deferred until the first frame of the new representation is getting rendered.

title: Improve video resolution change handling
message:
Improve video resolution change handling

This changes the surface size from being fixed to the resolution of the video to taking the size that the UI permits. Because of this change, the resizing of the fixed surface is no longer visible, resulting in smoother DASH representation changes. It also changes the processing resolution / texture size of the GLES view, which is now also the taken screen size instead of the video size. This speeds up shader processing if the native video resolution is higher that the screen space, but slows it down if the video's resolution is smaller; optimally, it would be the screen space size or video size, whatever is smaller.

title: Adjust variable name
message: Adjust variable name

title: Improve DASH segment caching
message:
Improve DASH segment caching

Caching key type changed from segment (which is a different object for every representation) to integer (the segment sequence is similar in each representation [at least for the current test videos; could be different though]), so no matter which representation's segment is cached, it can be taken from the cache by with the same key. Because of this change, the representation can now change at precaching time instead of directly at playback time (through a blocking download), resulting in much smoother playback.
